title: 115_hr1574
content: The "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" is a bill that aims to provide viewpoint protection in communications. It amends Title I of the Communications Act of 1934 to include provisions for protecting viewpoints. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the revocation of licenses based on viewpoints expressed in broadcast content. The Commission is also restricted from imposing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the Commission from placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews under certain sections. This does not affect the Commission's authority to take action based on such approvals. The bill "Protecting Dissenting Viewpoints and Voices Act of 2017" prohibits the Commission from placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews under certain sections. This does not affect the Commission's authority to take action based on violations of specific sections of the United States Code. The bill prohibits the Commission from placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews under certain sections of the United States Code. This includes violations of specific sections related to content dissemination through radio or television broadcast. The bill prohibits the Commission from placing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews related to content dissemination through radio or television broadcast. This includes violations of specific sections of the United States Code. The President may retaliate on the basis of viewpoint. The bill prohibits the Commission from imposing conditions on viewpoints in transaction reviews for radio or TV broadcast content. The President is not allowed to retaliate based on viewpoints expressed in public content dissemination. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to impose conditions on viewpoints in content broadcast by individuals or entities seeking approval. The bill prohibits the President from influencing agencies to impose conditions on viewpoints in broadcast content, preserving freedom of expression. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action or impose conditions on broadcast content based on violations of specific laws. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action or impose conditions on broadcast content based on violations of specific laws, including sections related to radio or television broadcast dissemination. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action on broadcast content based on specific laws, including incitement under the First Amendment or duties under any provision of law. The bill prohibits the President from directing agencies to take action on broadcast content based on specific laws, including incitement under the First Amendment or duties under any provision of law. The term "agency" is defined as in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
